docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru--Military regimes are still firmly entrenched in much of South America--Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay, Brazil. But after a decade of similar authoritian rule, the Andean countries--Peru, Ecuador and Bolivia--are moving toward...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru--Military regimes are still firmly entrenched in much of South America--Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay, Brazil. But after a decade of similar authoritian rule, the Andean countries--Peru, Ecuador and Bolivia--are moving toward restoring civilian democracy.
docs.abstract: article on shaky restoration of civilian rule; econ, pol and soc situations noted; chart shows consumer price increases; drawing (M)

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 9  For the second time in little more than a month, the executive board of the International Olympic Committee began meeting today to consider the expulsion of Taiwan and China's application for readmission to the Games.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 9 For the second time in little more than a month, the executive board of the International Olympic Committee began meeting today to consider the expulsion of Taiwan and China's application for readmission to the Games.
docs.abstract: Internatl Olympic Com begins meeting, Lausanne, Switzerland, to consider expulsion of Taiwan and China's application for re-admission to Olympic Games (M)

headline.main: I.O.C. Board to Consider China, Taiwan Questions; A Delicate Matter

docs.snippet: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 10 -- The International Olympic Committee announced here today that China and Taiwan had agreed to meet to discuss what the committee president characterized as "the Chinese problem, the Chinese puzzle" of Olympic...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 10 -- The International Olympic Committee announced here today that China and Taiwan had agreed to meet to discuss what the committee president characterized as "the Chinese problem, the Chinese puzzle" of Olympic membership.
docs.abstract: announces that Taiwan and China have agreed to meet to discuss problem (M)

headline.main: Olympic Group Says China and Taiwan Plan Meeting

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 11--A repressive campaign by the Colombian armed forces against the principal urban guerrilla organization has produced widespread charges of violations of human rights and concern over the military's role in this country's...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 11--A repressive campaign by the Colombian armed forces against the principal urban guerrilla organization has produced widespread charges of violations of human rights and concern over the military's role in this country's democracy.
docs.abstract: Repressive campaign by Colombian armed forces against urban guerrilla group 19th of May Movement, or M-19, has produced widespread charges of human rights violations and concern over mil's role in Colombia's democracy; drive is estimated to have brought arrest of 1,000 people, of whom 130 are being held for mil trial; many of those arrested have charged they were tortured under questioning by mil officers to determine leadership of group and solution of several crimes; Pres Julio Cesar Turbay Ayala has denied that torture is practiced by mil and ordered inquiry to determine truth of charges (M)

headline.main: Colombia Army Said to Torture Leftist Suspects; COLOMBIAN MILITARY CRITICIZED ON RIGHTS Seeks Socialist Regime

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ALONE TOGETHER Purposeful stagings of late classics uptown at Columbia University have already made a marked contribution to the city's drama scene. The latest project of the Teachers College Theater is a new production of William Gibson's comedy,

docs.snippet: The New York Racing and Wagering Board, the New York Racing Association and The Jockey Club have been named co-defendants in a $150,000 damage suit filed in Supreme Court, New York County, on behalf of a Queens construction man, Joseph Parisi.
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Racing and Wagering Board, the New York Racing Association and The Jockey Club have been named co-defendants in a $150,000 damage suit filed in Supreme Court, New York County, on behalf of a Queens construction man, Joseph Parisi.
docs.abstract: Race horse owner Joseph Parisi files $150,000 damage suit against NYS Racing and Wagering Bd, NYRA and Jockey Club charging they mistakenly identified horse he purchased from veterinarian Dr Mark Gerard as Asdepique; it was later determined that Parisi's horse was Enchumao, horse with less ability than Asdepique (S)

headline.main: Horse's Mistaken Identity Is Subject of Damage Suit
